programme.desc: On his 80th birthday Tom builds a teepee, while Nancy plans him a surprise party. Jake runs a mountain lion off the highway during calving season. Paul hauls his trapping shed up a narrow mountain.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries (S4)
programme.desc: During WWII, the Nazis stole vast amounts of art, gold, silver, and currency, and stashed them across Europe. While some of the plunder has been recovered, much more is still missing nearly 80 years later.

programme.title: Holy Marvels With Dennis Quaid (S2)
programme.desc: From the strict codes of Hammurabi to the secretly malevolent evil eye, history is full of acts committed in the name of revenge. We uncover the forces that have driven individuals to seek vengeance.

programme.title: Dark Marvels
programme.desc: Since ancient times through the modern day, brutal games thrill both players and spectators. We explore the origins of history's deadliest games — from Roman bloodsports to Russian roulette.

programme.title: The Death Coast
programme.desc: Jeff MacKinnon's team searches Scatarie Island for the Feversham's lost fortune. Battling brutal currents, they uncover artefacts that may lead to treasure.

programme.desc: In Alone's most remote location, ten new survivalists must survive north of the Arctic Circle as they face the cold and dwindling sun for a chance to win $500,000.

programme.title: The UnBelievable With Dan Aykroyd (S2)

programme.title: Kingdom (S1)
programme.desc: Four rival families - leopards, hyena, wild dogs and lions - all try to claim a rich corner of Zambian paradise as their home. Who will succeed in ruling this precious kingdom?

programme.title: Kingdom (S1)
programme.desc: Leopard Mutima's relationship with her mother is at breaking point, and as the balance of power in Nsefu tips towards the lions, the hyenas and wild dogs fight to raise their young.

programme.title: Kingdom (S1)
programme.desc: Leopard Olimba finds a mate, but fortunes turn against the lions. Extreme flooding leads to disaster for the hyena clan, and the time has come for leopard Mutima to leave.

programme.title: Kingdom (S1)
programme.desc: Injured wild dog Flint helps care for Storm's largest ever litter of pups. Leopard Mutima searches for a home, and the lions are challenged by forces beyond their control.

programme.title: Kingdom (S1)
programme.desc: The final chapter. Olimba struggles with old age, and the wild dog story takes an unexpected turn. The lions and the hyenas both enjoy a baby boom - but who has the power to rule?

programme.title: Kingdom (S1)
programme.desc: Meet the people that made filming Kingdom possible and uncover the extraordinary acts of conservationists and anti-poaching teams protecting South Luangwa and all its inhabitants.

programme.title: Running Wild with Bear Grylls (S2)
programme.desc: Actor Michael B. Jordan joins Grylls in Wales where they start their journey by dropping into rough waters off the coast before making their way up the coast and to the top of the mountains for their exit.

programme.title: Secrets of the Jurassic Dinosaurs (S1)
programme.desc: An international team of palaeontologists in the remote badlands of Wyoming investigate a mysterious dinosaur graveyard. Packed with over a dozen skeletons including predators such as the fearsome Allosaurus and iconic giants like Diplodocus, as well as fossilised plants and footprints.

programme.title: Incredible Journeys with Simon Reeve (S1)
programme.desc: In this third episode, Simon focuses on some of the incredible wildlife stories he's encountered.

programme.title: Saving Venice
programme.desc: Venice is under attack from climate change. Flooding is becoming more frequent. With each inundation of seawater, more salt impregnates the city's historic buildings. As it crystallises, it rips the bricks, mortar and stone to shreds. The city is crumbling. Venice's very existence is hanging in the balance. Can scientists and engineers find ways to protect this unique jewel of architecture, beauty and culture before it's too late?

Can scientists and engineers find ways to protect this unique jewel of architecture, beauty and culture before it's too late?

programme.title: Running Wild with Bear Grylls (S2)

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.(n)

programme.title: My Street Piano
programme.desc: On a shopping street in front of Kagoshima Chuo Station sits Japan' s original street piano, which passersby love to visit and play from the heart.(n)

programme.title: Hometown Stories
programme.desc: Painter Yoshinari Ishimura has autism. His late mother sparked his love of animals, which now inspires his work. With his father's help, Yoshinari is expanding his world and bringing joy to others.(n)

programme.title: Satoyama Kitchen Fall
programme.desc: At the Satoyama Kitchen guesthouse in Hida Takayama, chef Nobuko, her cameraman husband Makoto and their cat Tama take us on a tasty journey of local cuisine served with a side of seasonal scenery.(n)

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.(n)

programme.title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: At the Niihama Taiko Matsuri, teams of around 150 people carry taikodai: three-tonne parade floats housing a huge taiko drum. They compete to give the most powerful synchronized performance.(n)

programme.title: Nun's Seasonal Calendar
programme.desc: In this episode, we learn about the fall chrysanthemum festival and the autumnal equinox, or shubun. The nuns enjoy sushi, salad, and dumplings made specially for the occasion.(n)

programme.title: Magical Japanese
programme.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history, and culture. This episode looks at words related to hot water. Explore the unique culture behind them.(n)

programme.title: Easy Japanese
programme.desc: #7 Please speak slowly. / To ask someone to speak slowly, say "yukkuri hanashite kudasai".(n)

programme.title: Culture Crossroads
programme.desc: Japanese high-tech toys, fusing advanced technology and 'kawaii' culture, are booming, even in education and space exploration. Through a Chinese woman at a toy maker, we look at their global advance.(n)

programme.title: HELLO! NHK WORLD-JAPAN
programme.desc: We intorduce the contents and activities of NHK WORLD-JAPAN to make the station and programs known to more people all over the world. This is the window of the station to the world.(n)

programme.desc: Hara Kazuo is the first person from Asia to win the Golden Ring Special Edition prize at an Italian film festival that explores the dark side of movies. He talks about his vision for documentaries.(n)

programme.title: trails to Oishii Tokyo mini 5min.

programme.title: On the Wings 5min.

programme.desc: Kagura is a traditional performance of music and dance. Buzen Kagura features 24 well-known pieces including an acrobatic feat and a tale from Japanese myth. Children present the same pieces.

programme.title: Nun's Seasonal Calendar
programme.desc: In this episode, we learn about ritto and shosetsu, two dates of early winter. The nuns teach us how to make seasonal pickles and dumplings.

programme.title: FRONTRUNNERS
programme.desc: Children with microtia are born with an underdeveloped ear. Wearing a mask or glasses is difficult, and they may be bullied. We meet Dr. Yotsuyanagi Takatoshi, a leading reconstructive surgeon.

programme.title: RAMEN JAPAN 5min.
programme.desc: A bowl of resilience! The unique, garlic-powered tonkotsu ramen.

programme.title: Trails to Oishii Tokyo
programme.desc: Visit specialty tofu makers across Tokyo that are deeply rooted in their local communities and see how the traditional food has come to be used in all kinds of cuisine, from east to west.

programme.title: The World Heritage Sites in Japan
programme.desc: The Kii Mountain Range is home to three deeply important spiritual locations: Kumano, Yoshino and Omine, and Mt. Koya. These three sites are connected by a verdant 300 km pilgrims' path.

programme.title: Hit the Road 5minutes
programme.desc: Let's take a drive in Saitama and discover its natural beauty and hidden gems. From Omiya, we head to Chichibu to see its famed SL train. En route, we savor local dishes and try washi paper crafting.

programme.title: Dive in Tokyo
programme.desc: The Marunouchi district has repeatedly reinvented itself through large-scale development projects. We trace its evolution from a samurai quarter to an office district to a sophisticated business hub.

programme.title: Hometown Stories

programme.title: J-MELO
programme.desc: Join May J. for Japanese music! This week: singer-songwriter Kitamura Fuki, whose work ranges from piano-and-vocals to DJ sets; and 12-member Dreamers Union Choir, who bring powerful vocal harmonies.

programme.title: Little Charo
programme.desc: Little Charo is an animation series about a Japanese dog who got lost in NY. "I want to see my owner again!" Charo starts his adventure back home. Season 2-17.

programme.title: Japanology Plus mini
programme.desc: For hundreds of years, Japanese people have used name stamps, known as hanko, to sign their name. In a 5-minute digest, we discover their history and explore what a hanko-free future might look like.

programme.title: A Cat's-Eye View of Japan
programme.desc: A cat takes a nap among the fragrant flowers at a farm that grows sweet pea flowers. Another cat takes a nap at an archery range! We meet more local cats as residents celebrate a unique tradition.

programme.title: CYCLE AROUND JAPAN Highlights
programme.desc: Come ride with us! Bicycle through the scenery of Japan, stay with locals and discover hidden traditions in a Japan you didn't know existed.

programme.title: The New Adventures of Rockie and Her Friends
programme.desc: Puppet action show for children. In a distant post-human future where surviving creatures have formed a community, new-breed dinosaur girl Rockie sets out on hilarious adventures with her schoolmates.

programme.title: u&i
programme.desc: This show for kids promotes a greater understanding for people with difficulties and helps develop empathy. With the help of two fairies, the main character thinks about what can be done to help.

programme.desc: "They're not trash cans, but resource bins," says Murakami Yuki, transforming garbage and scrap into useful materials. This sort of alchemy has earned praise and serious interest from industry.
